posts.author: C1QP0X
posts.content: I'm wanting to make another build for the level 20 section. Does anyone have any decent ideas for a level 20 version of The Charnel Lord by grizzled_dwarflord? I just want to stay true to the whole melee PM ideal.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Well, the thing about the Charnel Lord is that it spends its pre-epic life building up a 16 BAB to be able to have 4 attacks per round. For that intent, he needed 12 Fighter levels. For a level 20 environment, you need to figure out what's more important to you: having 4 APR or being immune to criticals. Because you'll need 13 levels AT LEAST, 14 ideally for a last skill dump to have critical hit immunity, which will significantly lower your BAB. You'll lose 5 points from PM alone, plus one from Bard. So from 20 BAB, you'll have 14. Worse base AB than a Cleric, and Clerics can buff it, Fighters can't.

There are some builds that don't adapt well in a level 20 environment, and to me this is one of them.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: C1QP0X
posts.content: Well, what do you think about ranged? Like, maybe a sling and shield with rapid shot. Do you see any potential there?

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Nope.

I don't see what an archer would benefit from critical hit immunity. Archers generally get hit by spells or by other archers. Spells don't do critical hits, and bows have a low chance of critting anyway.

Tell me something you want that is feasible and we will do it, but you must consider that for level 20, MANY THINGS change.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Your best bet at level 20 is to try and make a (Fighter 6/Bard 4/PM 10) if you want to follow Dwarflord's build.

The build will give you basically +6 AC more (and full tumble too) along with critical hits/sneak attack/paralysis/hold immunities.

It will have though a low (by warrior's standards) base AB of 14 and restrict your base attacks to 3. Still not a bad idea if you are focused to defensive play.

To make it work, start with a very high strength (17 or 19 if half-orc) and take exotic weapon proficiency with a bastard sword. Every bit counts at these levels.

Strap a tower shield on your off-hand and you are ready to go. The final AB and damage will not be that bad since you will also have UMD to boost your melee abilities with darkfire, holy sword, bless weapon, GMW, Keen edge e.t.c

*********************

But i want to bring into consideration another route you can go instead of the undead warrior. The dragonic one and namely the (Fighter 8/ Bard 2/ RDD 10) build.

In comparison to the PM, this guy has 2 less AC and no immunitie to sneak attacks/critical hits but hits like a truck, has 4 attacks/round and also have a huge AB all of his own. He still has all the other tricks the PM has and a very useful immunity to fire damage too.

If you think about it, only very few enemies will be able to hit you at those levels with either of those builds (more like AA's or Bosses) since RDD gets a pretty good AC boost as well, provided you keep a tower shield on your off-hand and the elemental fire immunity is very handy to have. The main difference is that this build will give you awesome damage as well. You still have UMD here as well.

********************

So to capitalize, if you are into an RP concept specific to an undead warrior then go with the PM, but if that isn't your primary reason i would go with the RDD without a second thought.

There is a reason why RDD builds are so damn popular, especially in pre-epic environments.
